department.ch: 人力資源管理研究所碩士班

goal.ch: This course considers job design and overall organizational design because similar principles apply to both. Organizational and job design is a primary management tool for organizing business processes and developing organizational competencies and capabilities for competing in today’s dynamic environment. In this course, we emphasize the idea that a key goal of organizational design is effective creation and use of knowledge. A firm can design overall structure and individual jobs to optimize at a point in time or to innovate and adopt. Students are expected to apply the principles of organizational and job design learned in this course to manage organizational change in response to changing environments.
